entries.title: Remember, the Brendan Fraser Renaissance Began With Doom Patrol
entries.description: People are ready for Brendan Fraser to make his comeback. By all accounts, that will happen with The Whale, Darren Aronofsky’s upcoming film starring Fraser as a 600-lb. English teacher trying to reconnect with his daughter, which buzz sugge

entries.title: Inhaling Whippits Left a Man Unable to Walk
entries.description: In a new paper this month, doctors describe how a 32-year-old man’s habit of inhaling nitrous oxide via “whippits” left him partially paralyzed. Following treatment and the end of his nitrous oxide use, the man did eventually regain the function of his legs. But the medical tale is perhaps a timely reminder of why…

entries.title: Climate Change Has Made Existing Flood Maps Outdated, Admits FEMA Director
entries.description: In and around Jackson, Mississippi, more than 180,000 people have been without running or drinkable water for over a week. Flooding from heavy rainfall damaged water treatment plants and other infrastructure, exacerbating

entries.title: 'I'm Not a Spy:' Israeli Defense Minister's Housekeeper Sentenced to Three Years For Offering to Load Computer With Malware for Iran-Linked Hackers
entries.description: A former housekeeper for Israel Defense Minister Benny Gantz will spend three years in prison for allegedly attempting to infect the official’s computer with malware in exchange for cash from Iran-linked hackers. The cleaner, the BBC notes, ag

entries.title: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes Requests a New Trial
entries.description: Elizabeth Holmes—the founder of blood testing startup Theranos and the poster child for misleading investors, media, and innocent people looking for medical care through a web of deceit—wants a do-over. She is requesting a new trial, according to a document filed Tuesday in the Southern District Court of California.

entries.title: Ether Plans to Lose Proof-of-Work While Crypto Miners Lose Their Minds
entries.description: There’s a diamond shaped hole in the earth that’s getting unknowingly deep, and we’re all staring into its depths with minds grown ragged with questions. “The Merge,” which promises a move from the old proof-of-work consensus model to the proof-of-stake, is coming on in a week’s time, if promises from a notoriously…

entries.title: Scientists Are Working on New and Improved Hair Loss Treatments
entries.description:
The near-future of hair loss treatment seems to be quite promising. Recent research in mice points to a potentially new way of restoring hair, while other approaches are set to undergo clinical trials in humans soon.

Read more...

entries.title: Google Will Unveil the Pixel 7 on Oct. 6 in New York City
entries.description: Not to be forgotten in the maelstrom of the Apple event news, Google has officially announced the next Made By Google launch event. The event is happening Thursday, Oct. 6 a

entries.title: CNN Hires Ex-Cop Accused of Lying About NYPD's Surveillance of Muslims
entries.description: CNN has announced a new hire: John Miller, the former head of the New York Police Department’s intelligence unit.

entries.title: Terrifying Video Shows a Drop Tower Ride Malfunctioning at a Carnival in India
entries.description:
It’s a carnival goers’ worst nightmare come to life. A drop tower ride at a carnival in India plummeted to the ground, dropping 50-feet before crashing at the bottom. Several people suffered injuries from the drop, and were rushed to nearby hospitals.

Read more...

entries.title: Warner Bros. and DC Films Are Still Looking for Their Kevin Feige [Updated]

entries.title: Doomsday Glacier Is 'Holding on... by Its Fingernails'
entries.description: The Thwaites Glacier, one of the most unstable parts of Antarctica’s ice sheet, could be gearing up for even more rapid changes than we previously thought. In a study published this week in Nature Geoscience, a team of researchers have publishe

entries.title: Juul Agrees to Nearly $440 Million Settlement Over Marketing Vapes to Kids

entries.title: Politician's Racist Selfie Video With Roma Woman Enflames Italian Social Media
entries.description: A far-right politician in Italy made waves online Monday after posting a video of himself walking up to a Roma woman and telling Italians that a vote for his party in this month’s elections will ensure they “never see her again” in the city of Florence.

entries.title: Twitter's Rightfully Obsessed With the Don't Worry Darling Movie Premiere
entries.description:
I spend way too much time on the internet, and this morning I found that social media’s newest obsession is the drama surrounding Olivia Wilde’s psychological thriller Don’t Worry Darling. 

Read more...

entries.title: Why Hydrogen Leaks Continue to Be a Major Headache for NASA Launches
entries.description:
NASA’s Space Launch System is powered by a mixture of liquid hydrogen and liquid oxygen. Together, these elements provide for a compact and extremely powerful rocket propellant, but these same attributes are also what make this fuel a liability.

Read more...

entries.title: The Solar Orbiter Spacecraft Just Got Hit by a Gigantic Outburst From the Sun

entries.title: Signal Has a New President and She Wants You to Pay
entries.description: Since its debut eight years ago, the face of the encrypted messaging app Signal has been its founder Moxie Marlinspike. In January, Marlinspike said he’d be stepping down as CEO. And while Signal hasn’t found a permanent replacement for its top executive, i

entries.title: Hackers Hide Malware in App Pretending to Be China-Repressed Uyghur Activist's Memoir
entries.description:
Hackers are targeting members of the ever-repressed minority Uyghur community in western China by trying to get users to download a fake app version of a book released by a prominent Uyghur activist.

Read more...

entries.title: TikTok Is Denying It Was Hacked After a Cybercrime Gang Claimed to Leak Users' Data
entries.description:
Was TikTok hacked? According to the company itself, the answer to that question is: definitely not. And security researchers who have looked into the matter seem to agree.

Read more...

entries.title: What to Expect from Apple’s iPhone 14 Event Tomorrow
entries.description: Apple’s iPhone 14 event is less than a day away. The “Far Out” event, as the company is calling it, will take place on Sept. 7 at 10 A.M. PT / 1 P.M. ET. in person at the Steve Jobs Theater at Apple’s Cupertino headquarters. Apple will live stream it online for anyone who wants to watch it at home.

entries.description: YouTube was on the precipice of cutting all of its most profitable ads amid fallout from Elsagate, the most bizarre scandal in the history of the biggest video-sharing site on the internet. entries.description: A huge oilfield in the Gulf of Mexico, which caused a hellish fire in the ocean last year, has been releasing massive amounts of planet-warming methane. Reuters

entries.title: Apple Ordered to Cease Selling iPhones Without Chargers in Brazil
entries.description: The Brazilian government’s going to battle with Apple over its chargers, or more aptly, its lack of them. On Tuesday, Brazil’s Justice Ministry reportedly hit the smartphone giant for 12.275 million reais (or around $2.38 million) and ordered Apple to cease selling models that don’t ship with a charger. That sudden…

entries.title: Binance Will Transform Users' Stablecoins to Its Own Brand of Coin, and They're Not Asking First
entries.description: In a few weeks’ time, stablecoin holders on Binance will find their crypto doesn’t carry the same name, or the same price, as it had previously. The exchange effectively told its users it’ll be digging its long, thin fingers into each of their wallets, taking out their old crypto, and replacing it with their own,…

entries.title: Updates From Andor, Shazam Fury of the Gods, and More
entries.description: The Spy Kids reboot has finished filming. Get another look at Disney’s rapidly-incoming Pinocchio remake. Terry Silver wants you to be a winner in a new Cobra Kai teaser. Plus, what’s coming on House of the Dragon, and Rick and Morty gets its shill on ahead of the new season. Spoilers now!

entries.title: YouTuber Solves Mystery of Weird TV-Movie in 1990s Family Photo
entries.description: Will Sloan, a movie podcast host in Canada, first posted an old family photo online in 2016, asking if anyone knew what cartoon was playing on the TV in the background. Oddly, nobody could figure it out. But someone finally cracked the case on Monday after six long years.
